did.unittitle: List of subscribers toward the purchase of The Automaton Chess-Player

scopecontent.p: These materials comprise the lists of subscribers in Philadelphia in 1840 to the purchase of the Automaton Chess-Player. The Automaton was the invention of Wolfgang de Kempelen, a Hungarian. According to a notation made in the one notebook of this collection, the amount to be raised for the purchase of this invention was $500. The minimum accepted subscription was to be five dollars because it was "desirable to have as few present as possible, when the secret is to be explored."
